results.title: Schefferville 4th Arctic Winter Games
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roman Kroitor and Dennis Sawyer
results.brief_description: An exciting view of the Arctic Winter Games held in Schefferville, northern Quebec, in 1976. The events range from table-tennis to curling, and include six indigenous Arctic sports. The games spanned seven days of hard competition, as well as a week of sharing common northern experiences and good will. And, despite temperatures of -30C, the participants’ enthusiasm created an atmosphere of great warmth, which we witness as the losers congratulate the winners, and the winners apologise.

results.title: Scent of a woman
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, City Lights Films and Martin Brest
results.brief_description: It’s thanksgiving weekend in New York and Lt. Colonel Frank Slade (Al Pacino) is in town for a slice of the good life: fine cuisine, beautiful women chauffered limousines and a suite at the Waldorf-Astoria. The naive and young Charlie Simms (Chris O’Donnell) is reluctantly along for the ride, getting the education of a lifetime. Slade is one of life’s true originals, now blind, irascible yet with a touch of the poet. Charlie is an earnest young prep student facing a difficult crossroads in his life. Their raucous, revealing and at times hysterical adventure in New York will leave them both changed forever.

results.title: Scenes from the class struggle in Beverly Hills
results.creator_credit: James C. Katz, North Street Films and Paul Bartel
results.brief_description: Director Paul Bartel (Eating Raoul, Lust in the Dust) brings a breezy, sophisticated touch to this outrageous sex farce set in Beverly Hills. The plot centres on the sexual antics that ensue when a snooty divorcee (Mary Woronov), her withdrawn teenage son, her pretentious playwright brother and his sassy black wife move in with their next door neighbour, a widowed ex-soap star (Jacqueline Bisset) while their house is being fumigated. Adding to the ‘upstairs-downstairs’ mix is the soap star’s precocious daughter, her campy friend and the women’s respective houseboys. When the two servants challenge each other to sleep with their respective employers, the stage is set for a wild weekend of bed swapping.

results.title: Scenes from a marriage
results.brief_description: A passionate, probing and honest look at a marriage, its disintegration and the relationship that follows. Liv Ullman and Erland Josephson are remarkable throughout this intimate and often painful portrait which Bergamn originally made as 6 50 minute episodes for television and subsequently edited into a full-length feature. Bergman examines the trauma of a beleagured marriage largely in close-up creating an exhaustive study of the doubt, despair, confusion and loneliness experienced by Marianne on discovering her husband’s infidelity with a younger woman. Swedish language with English subtitles.

results.title: Scenes and songs from Boyd Webb
results.creator_credit: Philip Haas, Methodact, Arts Council of Great Britain and Boyd Webb
results.brief_description: Boyd Webb is usually classified as a sculptor although he does not exhibit three-dimensional objects. His art-works are extremely large photographs. In this film, the artist has designed eight new works specifically for the film camera. They expand on recent photographic pieces which have dealt with the vagaries of life in a post-nuclear era.

results.title: Scattering stars
results.brief_description: Heavenly bodies explode. Stars scatter. The after-glow of a physical encounter. ‘Against a pitch-black night-time sky, splendid fireworks explode. From a different darkness, gleaming male body parts light up. Meticulous editing and solarisation make the fireworks seem to emerge from the very centre of the human bodies’.

results.title: Scary movie [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Dimension Pictures, Eric Gold, Lee Mayes and Keenen Ivory Wayans
results.brief_description: The popularity of teenage slasher films in the 1980’s and 1990’s including ‘I Know What You Did Last Summer ‘, ‘Halloween’ and the ‘Scream’ trilogy lead to this parody film directed by Keenen Ivory Wayans. Ray, Brenda, Buffy, Shorty, Ray, Greg, Bobby and Cindy are on the run from a serial killer, seeking his revenge after the kids run him over following their school prom. Also causing problems for the ditzy teens are a nosy reporter Gail Hailstorm, assistant police officer Doofy and high school principal, Squiggly. Incidentally, ‘Scary Movie’ was the working title for the original ‘Scream’ film. Cast includes Marlon Wayans, Shawn Wayans, Shannon Elizabeth, Regina Hall, Lochlyn Munro, Anna Faris and Jon Abrahams.

results.title: Scarlet Street
results.creator_credit: Walter Wanger, Universal Pictures and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: Lang’s darkest American film is a twisted moral tale that benefits from Edward G Robinson’s fine performance as a company man who is driven to embezzlement as a result of his passion for a scheming vixen. Lang’s impeccable shadowed visions and the air of slovenly decadence with which he surrounds the woman and her secret lover, plus the raw force of the bitter ending, set this apart from the subsequent tales of seduction by a femme fatale. Also stars Joan Bennett and Dan Durea. Based on the play La chienne by George de la Fouchardiere and previously filmed by Jean Renoir.

results.title: Scarfies [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lisa Chatfield, Nightmare Productions and Robert Sarkis
results.brief_description: A young group of Scarfies (local slang for students at Otago University, Dunedin) move into a squat but get more than they bargain for after discovering a crop of marijuana in the basement. Their initial exuberance gives way to panic when the owner returns for his crop. The group lock him into the basement while they figure out what to do. Starting as a light comedy, “Scarfies” shifts a gear and becomes increasingly black, resulting in a nightmarish thriller where the central characters’ morale and logic having fallen apart give way to desperate behaviour. Cast includes: Willa O’Neill, Neill Rea, Ashleigh Seagar, Taika Cohen, Charlie Bleakley, John Brazier, Mark Neilson and Mark Dudfield.

results.title: Scarface = the shame of a nation
results.brief_description: A detailed chronicle of the life of Chicago gangster Al Capone, played by Paul Muni, with Ann Dvorak as an incestuous sister thrown in for good measure. This brutal and graphic film was made in 1931, but its release was delayed by the censors. Based on the novel by Armitage Traill, this film is also known as “the Shame of a Nation”.
